Description: Mould-made scaraboid in glazed composition; back in form of curled lion; underside deeply incised with hieroglyphic inscription arranged horizontally with from right to left, nfr-sign, couchant hare and sun-disc; longitudinally pierced; pinky red core of coarse texture.
Curator's comments: Its shape is very rare in the corpus of scaraboids from Naukratis. Even if Petrie illustrated the impression of a mould in the shape of a curled lion (Petrie 1886, pl. XXXVIII, no. 7), he did not list it in his description of the moulds discovered at the site (Petrie 1886, 37). Such scaraboids were, nonetheless, likely produced locally in the 'Scarab Factory' (on its various productions, see Gorton 1996, 91-131; Webb forthcoming). For a scaraboid with a curled lion back from Naukratis, see also the one published in Petrie 1886, pl. XXXVII, no. 110. This scaraboid could belong to Gorton's type XXXIII A, although the specific shape of this scaraboid and this exact combination of hieroglyphs is not listed in this type (Gorton 1996, 118-121, type XXXIII A). Though the hieroglyphic signs on its base could have just some magical value, it seems plausible that this is a cryptographic reading for the name of Amun (on the cryptic writing of the name of Amun: Drioton 1957). The lion shape of the scaraboid itself can be associated with solar deties. Lions were used to write the name of Ra during the Late Period, as the lion is a phonetic equivalent Rw (De Wit 1951, 138ff). Other specialists see the epithet of Osiris, Ounnefer: Keel 2013, 456-7, no. 674. De Wit, C. 1951, Le rôle et le sens du lion dans l’Egypte ancienne, Leiden. Drioton, E. 1957, 'Trigrammes d'Amon', Festschrift Hermann Junker zum 80. Geburtstag (Wiener Zeitschrift für die Kunde des Morgenlandes 54), Wien, 11-33. Gardner, E. A. 1888, Naukratis. Part II (Sixth Memoir of the Egypt Exploration Fund), London. Gorton, A.F. 1996, Egyptian and Egyptianizing scarabs: a typology of steatite, faience, and paste scarabs from Punic and other Mediterranean sites, Oxford. Keel, O. 2013, Corpus der Stempelsiegel-Amulette aus Palästina/Israel : von den Anfängen bis zur Perserzeit, Orbis biblicus et orientalis, Series Archaeologica 33, Fribourg. Petrie, W.M.F. 1886, Naukratis. Part I, 1884–5 (Third Memoir of the Egypt Exploration Fund), London. Webb, V. forthcoming, Faience finds from Naukratis and their implications for the chronology of the site, in R. Thomas (ed.) forthcoming. Naukratis in Context I: The Nile Delta as a Landscape of Connectivity. Proceedings of the First Naukratis Project Workshop held at The British Museum, 16th –17th December 2011.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (OF.21) (phase 3)
